intro: Hieracium sabulosorum, commonly known as the sandy hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to sandy and disturbed soils in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium sabulosorum is often found in open habitats such as roadsides, dunes, and grasslands.
